publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3664# Kate Maclean: Race Equality Training—That the Parliament recognises the need to obtain race equality training for all its members to ensure that members can lead by example at a time when public sector authorities are subject to new statutory duties to promote race equality; considers that the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body should provide such training, and considers that the leadership of every political party in the Parliament should commit itself to ensuring that all its parliamentary members attend such training.
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Mr Michael McMahon*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Linda Fabiani*, Michael Matheson*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Trish Godman*, Bill Butler*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Sarah Boyack*, Mr Murray Tosh*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Dr Richard Simpson*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Scott Barrie*, Elaine Smith*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Shona Robison*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Jackie Baillie*, Irene McGugan*, Dennis Canavan*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Ms Wendy Alexander*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Karen Gillon*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Cathy Peattie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-3664# Race Equality Training (lodged on 28 November 2002) Susan Deacon*

S1M-3664# Kate Maclean: Race Equality Training—That the Parliament recognises the need to obtain race equality training for all its members to ensure that members can lead by example at a time when public sector authorities are subject to new statutory duties to promote race equality; considers that the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body should provide such training, and considers that the leadership of every political party in the Parliament should commit itself to ensuring that all its parliamentary members attend such training. Supported by: Mr Michael McMahon, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Michael Matheson, Ms Sandra White, Trish Godman, Bill Butler, Tommy Sheridan, Nora Radcliffe, Sarah Boyack, Mr Murray Tosh, Dr Richard Simpson, Scott Barrie, Elaine Smith, Shona Robison, Donald Gorrie, Margaret Jamieson, Jackie Baillie, Irene McGugan, Dennis Canavan, Ms Wendy Alexander, Karen Gillon, Cathy Peattie, Marilyn Livingstone, Irene Oldfather, Susan Deacon
